member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement2D
member.summary: Represents a continuum finite element for 2D problems. Specific elements (e.g. Quad4, Tri6, ...) can be created using the appropriate , etc. strategies. The thickness of this element is uniform, therefore it is necessary to use finer meshes to simulate domains with variable thickness. Authors: Serafeim Bakalakos

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement2D.FindCentroid
member.summary: Calculates the coordinates of the centroid of this element.

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement2D.GetNodalDofs
member.summary: The returned structure is a list with as many entries as the number of nodes of this element. Each entry contains a list with the dofs of the corresponding node. E.g. For node idx = 3, dof idx = 2 the IDof is result[3][2].

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement2D.UpdateStrainsStressesAtGaussPoints(System.Double[])
member.summary: Calculate strains (exx, eyy, 2exy) and stresses (sxx, syy, sxy) at integration points, store them in the materials and return them (e.g. for postprocessing). The order of the tensors is the same as the order of the integration points defined by .

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement2D.BuildShapeFunctionMatrix(System.Double[])
member.summary: The shape function matrix is 2-by-2n, where n = is the number of shape functions. Row 0 corresponds to dof X, while row 1 to dof Y.

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement2DFactory
member.summary: Creates isoparametric continuum elements with uniform thickness. Abstracts the interpolations, integrations, extrapolations and any other strategies that differentiate the elements (e.g. Quad4 from Tri6). It is also very convenient when the thickness and material properties are the same throughout the whole domain or a region. Authors: Serafeim Bakalakos

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3D
member.summary: Represents a continuum finite element for 3D problems. Specific elements (e.g. Hexa8, Hexa20, ...) can be created using the appropriate , etc. strategies. Authors: Dimitris Tsapetis

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3D.FindCentroid
member.summary: Calculates the coordinates of the centroid of this element.

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3D.BuildDeformationMatrix(MGroup.LinearAlgebra.Matrices.Matrix)
member.summary: Assembles the deformation matrix of a solid element. The calculation are based on paragraph 8.4, equation 8.7

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3D.BuildShapeFunctionMatrix(System.Double[])
member.summary: The shape function matrix is 2-by-2n, where n = is the number of shape functions. Row 0 corresponds to dof X, while row 1 to dof Y, etc.

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3DFactory
member.summary: Creates isoparametric continuum 3D elements. Abstracts the interpolations, integrations, extrapolations and any other strategies that differentiate the elements(e.g. Hexa8, Hexa20) It is also very convenient when the material properties are the same throughout the whole domain or a region. Authors: Dimitris Tsapetis

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3DNonLinear
member.summary: Continuum finite Element for 3d problems with material and geometric nonlinearities Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.ContinuumElement3DNonLinearDefGrad
member.summary: Continuum finite Element for 3d problems with material and geometric nonlinearities Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Continuum.Hexa8NonLinear
member.summary: Continuum finite Element for 3d problems with material and geometric nonlinearities Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveElementEmbedder
member.summary: Appropriate superelement dofenumerator for problems with embedding of elements. update of the original class Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveShell8ToHexa20
member.summary: Cohesive element for modeling of delamination and debonding effects between parts modeled with shell and hexa20 elements. Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: P:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveShell8ToHexa20.ShellElementSide
member.summary: Zero denotes bottom surface of the shell element

member.name: F:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveShell8ToHexa20.ox_i_shell_midsurface
member.summary: Initial coordinates of shell midsurface nodes

member.name: F:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveShell8ToHexa20.ox_i
member.summary: Initial nodel coordinates of 16 node inner cohesive element

member.name: F:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveShell8ToHexa20.x_local
member.summary: Unrolled current nodal coordinates of 16 node inner cohesive element

member.name: F:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.CohesiveShell8ToHexa20.ak_total
member.summary: Auxiliary variables for calculating rotations and updating the element's direction vectors.

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.EmbeddedCohesiveGrouping
member.summary: Appropriate for iplementing embedding kinematic constraints only for some nodes of the embedded element so that bond slip phenomena can be modeled. Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Embedding.EmbeddedCohesiveSubGrouping
member.summary: Appropriate for iplementing embedding kinematic constraints only for some nodes of the embedded element so that bond slip phenomena can be modeled. Element specific host groups Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos

member.name: M:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Helpers.Shell8DirectionVectorUtilities.RotateNodalDirectionVectors(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double[][],System.Double[][])
member.summary: Used by cohesive shell elements for now

members.member:
Calculates the constitutive stiffness of the element.
@return The constitutive stiffness

Calculates the forces in the global coordinate system.
@return The forces in the global coordinate system

Calculates the forces in the local coordinate system.
@return The forces in the local coordinate system

Calculates forces in the natural coordinate system.
@return The forces in the natural coordinate system

Calculates the geometric stiffness of the element.
@return The geometric stiffness

Calculates the stiffness matrix in the local coordinate system.
@return The stiffness matrix in the local coordinate system.

Calculates the transformation matrix from natural to local coordinate system.
@return The natural to local transformation matrix

Calculates the transformation matrix from natural to local coordinate system.
@return The natural to local transformation matrix

member.name: T:MGroup.FEM.Structural.Shells.Shell8NonLinear
member.summary: Shell elements for 3d problems with material and geometric nonlinearities. Out of plane shear deformation of the modeled shell structure is assumpted. Authors: Gerasimos Sotiropoulos
